title: David's Prayer for Mercy
shortSummary: Psalm 86 is a heartfelt prayer of David expressing his dependence on God's mercy, faithfulness, and protection amidst adversity. It highlights God's unique greatness, compassion, and readiness to forgive, encouraging believers to trust and seek guidance from Him.
timeline: c. 1010-970 BC - Reign of King David

keyCharacters.name: David
keyCharacters.description: The psalmist and king of Israel who earnestly prays for God's mercy, protection, and guidance in this chapter.

keyCharacters.name: The Proud and Violent Men
keyCharacters.description: Adversaries who rise against David, seeking his life and showing disregard for God.

definitions.definition: God’s compassionate treatment of those in distress, withholding deserved punishment and providing help.
Earnest and humble prayers or requests made to God.
A phrase referring to the depths of Sheol or the grave, symbolizing extreme distress or danger from which God delivers.
God’s patient endurance and willingness to withhold immediate judgment.

outline.heading: David’s Plea for Mercy and Help
outline.description: David opens with a humble appeal for God to hear his prayer, preserve his soul, and show mercy, acknowledging God's goodness and readiness to forgive those who call upon Him.

outline.heading: Confidence in God’s Response and Uniqueness
outline.description: David expresses trust that God will answer in times of trouble and affirms that no other gods or works compare to the Lord’s greatness and wondrous deeds.

outline.heading: Request for Guidance and Praise
outline.description: David asks God to teach him His ways and unite his heart in reverence, promising wholehearted praise in response to God’s great mercy and deliverance.

outline.heading: Opposition and God’s Compassion
outline.description: David acknowledges the hostility of proud and violent enemies but contrasts this with God’s compassionate, gracious, and merciful nature.

outline.heading: Final Plea for Strength and Vindication
outline.description: David requests God’s strength, salvation, and a visible sign of His help to shame his enemies and bring comfort to his soul.

application: Approach God daily with humble prayers, trusting in His mercy and readiness to forgive.
Seek God’s guidance and commit to walking in His truth with a united and reverent heart.
In times of trouble and opposition, remember God’s compassionate nature and rely on His strength for deliverance.
Praise God wholeheartedly for His faithfulness and wondrous works, even amid adversity.

keyVerses.text: For thou, Lord, art good, and ready to forgive; and plenteous in mercy unto all them that call upon thee.
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes God's character as merciful and forgiving, encouraging believers to call upon Him with confidence.

keyVerses.text: For thou art great, and doest wondrous things: thou art God alone.
keyVerses.significance: It affirms the uniqueness and greatness of God, highlighting His exclusive deity and mighty works.

keyVerses.text: Teach me thy way, O LORD; I will walk in thy truth: unite my heart to fear thy name.
keyVerses.significance: This verse models a believer’s desire for divine guidance and wholehearted devotion to God’s truth.

keyVerses.text: Shew me a token for good; that they which hate me may see it, and be ashamed: because thou, LORD, hast holpen me, and comforted me.
keyVerses.significance: It expresses a prayer for God’s visible help and vindication, reinforcing trust in His comforting power.
